alert.note: Alert for Grant; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 03 at 10:07AM EST until January 03 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EST THIS MORNING FOR GRANT, OWEN AND SOUTHERN PENDLETON COUNTIES... At 1007 AM EST, emergency management reported flash flooding southwest of Owenton, with water over roadways. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall of 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour is expected. While heavy rain is coming to an end, flash flooding will linger through the morning. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Dry Ridge, Owenton, Morgan, Corinth, Monterey, Gratz, Keefer, Lawrenceville, Cherry Grove, Stewartsville, Camp Northward, Cordova, Holbrook, New Columbus, Twin Bridges, Needmore, Natlee and Williamstown Lake. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
